intro: Coccoloba padifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, typically growing in moist, tropical environments. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, often with a waxy surface and a bluish-green hue. It produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, which are followed by red or orange berries. Coccoloba padifolia is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil types.
